rooms.description: Small foyer near the main entrance for receiving guests, incorporating local Kerala motifs and wooden beams.

Spacious living area with natural lighting from a large West-facing window, designed with traditional Kerala elements such as tiled floors and carved woodwork. The layout supports Vastu principles by aligning seating areas with the west side for positive energy.
Adjacent to the living room, designed for family gatherings. A window provides natural light and a view of the garden, ensuring harmony as per Vastu norms.

Compact yet functional kitchen placed in the northeast corner of the ground floor, following Vastu guidelines to harness positive energy. Traditional Kerala style with local stone finishes and open spaces for natural ventilation.
Primary bathroom on the ground level adjacent to the living area, ensuring privacy and easy access.
Cozy study/library space with built-in bookshelves and a reading nook. Placed towards the north to benefit from natural light while aligning with Vastu principles for intellectual activities.

openings.description: Traditional wooden door with intricate carvings, leading directly into the entrance hall.
Large window in the living room on the west side, maximizing natural light and adhering to the Vastu requirement for south-west or west openings.
Small balcony adjacent to the kitchen for ventilation and access to fresh air.
